meanings.definition: To start suddenly aside, as in alarm or surprise.
meanings.sent1: The horse was shying away from the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The cat kept shying away from the unfamiliar visitor.
meanings.sent3: The dog was shying from the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a monster.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was shying away from the idea of change.
meanings.sent5: The child was shying away from the dark, imagining monsters lurking.

meanings.definition: To draw back, as in fear or caution.
meanings.sent1: She was shying from the edge of the cliff, afraid of falling.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit kept shying away from the approaching predator.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was shying from the nut, thinking it might be a trap.
meanings.sent4: His mind was shying away from the memories of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The student was shying away from answering the difficult question in class.
